column4: is there a way to force remove a package? vmware-player won't complete the install and I can't remove it
which vmware-player? the ubuntu-package or a download from the vmware-site?
sudo /etc/init.d/vmnet stop && sudo rmmod vmnet , then try agagin
didn't work, vmnet isn't in /etc/init.d/
i see... then sudo rm -rf /etc/vmware (delete the vmware config-dir), then reboot and try to sudo apt-get remove --purge vmware-player
ok, I got it, I did a ps aux | grep vmnet and killed those processes, it's removed now, thanks

in general it's better to use lvm to deal with raid arrays in linux. So the kernel sees the drives individually and you set them up as soft-raid. Only when you want to access a previously created array you have to find and setup a linux-driver for the controller, that ake the kernel see the individual drives as one big drive
